Location: Brandon Park Community Centre
Start Date: 2010-06-12
End Date: 2010-06-14

]]> http://www.waverleymrc.org.au/2010/02/wmrc-2010-exhibition-2/feed/ 0 WMRC 2010 Exhibition http://www.waverleymrc.org.au/2010/01/wmrc-2010-exhibition/ http://www.waverleymrc.org.au/2010/01/wmrc-2010-exhibition/#comments Sun, 17 Jan 2010 06:14:00 +0000 gweir http://www.waverleymrc.org.au/?p=60 The WMRC 2010 Exhibition will be held on the Queen’s Birthday weekend 12th to 14th June 2010 at:

Brandon Park Community Centre
645 Ferntree Gully Road
Glen Waverley.

There will be layouts in 4 different scales, modelling Australian, USA, Japanese, European and UK prototypes.

GUEST LAYOUTS

‘Carlisle River’ VR On30, Stephen Holian
‘Benalta’ Aus HO, Mike Desailly
‘Whytecliffe’ early UK OO, Brian Smith
‘Dort Druben’ Euro N, Keith Flower
‘Cherry Blossom Park’ Japanese N, Ian Dingwall
‘Mittelstadt’ Marklin HO, Lutz Heerde
‘Twisty‘ Croydon MRC
‘Hornby Dublo 1959 – 1964′ Jeff Mills

WMRC LAYOUTS

‘Baldwin & Oswego’ USA N
‘Victoria Bridge’ Vic HO
‘Georgetown’ UK N
‘Becky’s ‘U’ Drive’

DEMOS

Lawrie Green & Grant McAdam, ‘The Art of the Diorama’

TRADE & OTHERS

ARHS
Branchline
Train World
Tinkering Tools
Tom’s Hobbies & TrainOrama
Craig Dunstone – Blue & Gold Models
Australian Aviation & Railway Photography
WMRC Sell Stand

Also a club information stand and a canteen!

We look forward to seeing you there.

]]> http://www.waverleymrc.org.au/2008/09/georgetown-photos/feed/ 0 Victoria Bridge recieves award at AMRA 2008 http://www.waverleymrc.org.au/2008/09/victoria-bridge-awarded-best-layout-at-amra/ http://www.waverleymrc.org.au/2008/09/victoria-bridge-awarded-best-layout-at-amra/#comments Mon, 01 Sep 2008 05:34:45 +0000 Michael Greenhill http://wmrc.corporate.firelight-design.com/?p=5 Our Victorian Railways HO scale layout “Victoria Bridge” has been named Best Club Layout at the AMRA 2008 exhibition

]]> http://www.waverleymrc.org.au/2008/09/victoria-bridge-awarded-best-layout-at-amra/feed/ 0 Blue & Gold Models acquires the G&E Models range http://www.waverleymrc.org.au/2008/08/blue-gold-models-acquires-the-ge-models-range/ http://www.waverleymrc.org.au/2008/08/blue-gold-models-acquires-the-ge-models-range/#comments Fri, 01 Aug 2008 05:35:32 +0000 Michael Greenhill http://wmrc.corporate.firelight-design.com/?p=7 For those new to the hobby, G&E Models were the manufacturers of a range of high-quality VR models, including the AV and BV pass cars, CW vans, and an assortment of structures such as railway stations and goods sheds.

After many years in the hobby, they have sold their range to a new start-up called Blue & Gold Models. Until now they have been specialising in scratchbuilding, kitbashing/kitbuilding and weathering of VR models. They plan to re-launch the former G&E range (a lot of which has been unavaliable for several years now) at the Croydon Model Railway Club’s annual exhibition, on the 13th and 14th of September.

It will take some time to get production of the entire range rolling, so until a full production line is set up a limited number items will be available from Branchline, The Buffer Stop and VHC by the end of the year.

The re-launch of the range will herald the arrival of the one-piece VR BCE kit, a completely new kit developed shortly before G&E sold their range.

The former G&E range are all resin kits, some (like the VR brick station building) with etched-brass detail parts. Their range includes APL, BPL, BCPL, AV, BV passenger cars; C, CE, CW, CS/VHN brake vans; and for infrastructure includes a VR brick station, VR 50′ goods shed, VR signal box, yardmasters office, ganger’s shed and rainwater tanks.

For more information, click here to read the discussion thread on Railpage.
